description: The city's oldest Anglican church is located in a beautiful park-like setting.

reviews.title: Quiet Cathedral
text: On a recent visit to Toronto I had the chance to visit several of the city's churches, St' James Cathedral was once the tallest steeple in Canada, the building was completed in 1874 and has lovely architecture in the Gothic style so reminiscent of European churches.

reviews.title: Lovely windows
text: I really enjoy visiting churches and this one is in the heart of old Toronto. It's a large church with some most beautiful stained glass windows

reviews.title: Beautiful stained glass windows
text: An impressive building with a tall tower and spire. A splendid, serene interior houses beautiful stained glass windows, which tell stories of the Bible and the history of the Christian church. On the rear wall of the cathedral is the pipe organ. Definitely worth a visit. It would be best on a Sunday if you wanted to hear the organ playing during a service!

reviews.title: St James Anglican Cathedral
text: St James Anglican Cathedral dates to the 1850s.At the time it was one of the largest buildings. Today it is still a beautiful building. Worth walking by and having a look.

reviews.title: Landmark
text: Landmark. This historic building is easily noticeable and well harmonized with other modern buildings in the background, including the CN tower. The roof was particularly appealing to me.

reviews.title: Beautiful church
text: Looked an amazing church from outside . We’re walking through downtown and found this beautiful church. Lots of seating around the church and it was a very peaceful place .. kids loved it outside ..

reviews.title: Walk in the door and feel the history
text: I had a lovely time wandering around the cathedral and sitting in one the pews listening to the organist in this gem of a Cathedral.
The Cathedral built in the Gothic revival Style was completed  in 1853

reviews.title: Gorgeous organ, beautiful stained glass windows
text: This Gothic style cathedral has beautiful ribbed vaults and gorgeous stained glass windows allows for generous illumination of the interior space with natural light. A massive organ with 5000 pipes makes the interior grandeur. The St. James Cathedral is definitely worth to visit if you are in Toronto.

reviews.title: Impressive House of Worship
text: During my travels I like to visit churches, and have done so throughout the world.  On my recent trip to Toronto, I had the opportunity to visit St. James Anglican Cathedral.  This is an impressive house of worship.  Persons interested in architecture, church history, and religion would enjoy visiting St. James.

reviews.title: Beautiful & Historical
text: First built in 1797, the original wooden church was replaced by the current stone version in 1853. It has looked pretty much the same since then, with its doors open to locals for worship much of the ensuing years. My Great Grandfather, who lived in St Lawrence Hall for the entirety of the depression and then some, spent his Sundays there and his wife, my gran, made oies for their suppers.  Excellent acoustics, if you're lucky, you might catch a practice or a concert there...lovely architecture,  a calm and tranquil spot to reflect, and the gardens next door in the park are gorgeous. Well worth a visit.

reviews.title: Lovely Old Church
text: They always seem so peaceful and the beautiful stained glass windows are mesmerizing. How they built them back in the day, to be so beautiful amazes me. Felt welcome there.

reviews.title: Christmas service in a very attractive church
text: St James Cathedral is known for its music, and its stained glass is also very good. A Christmas service here is inspiring even to unbelievers like myself. The church is open all day., and a visit even outside service times is rewarding.

reviews.title: Spectacular Cathedral in the heart of downtown Toronto
text: I attended this location in June 2018 for a meeting.  It is an old Cathedral, the heart of the Anglican community.  I was impressed by the architecture of the building. There is also a modern addition framed in  such a way so as not to detract from the beauty of the original Cathedral.   It is definitely an example of  old Toronto.

reviews.title: Unique Archectiture
text: This church is among some of the oldes churches in Toronto. It is beautiful inside and outside. You will thoroughly enjoy your visit to this church whether you attend a service or just tour the inside of the church. It has some of the most amazing ststues and carvings of religious figures you have ever seen and some of the most beautiful stain windows to behold. Rob Ford service was held in this church. Rob Ford was a very interesting man, he was a people's person. We should never forget him. He was one of-a-kind. May he rest iin peace with Christ. Please visit this church when you visit Toronto, it is a short walk from the Eaton Centre on east side of Queen Street.

reviews.title: Charming
text: On our way trekking round the city we came across st James cathedral. Big welcome in sign outside and gorgeous inside.
Interesting exhibition all about the Spanish flu.

reviews.title: WOOOW!
text: building not to be missed during a visit to Toronto.
art, history, culture: every corner tells a story.
Sit and enjoy the sounds and the way light comes in: its magical

reviews.title: A must to visit if you are downtown!!
text: Doors seem to be open every time I pass by there.  A lot of history and architecture and beautiful stained - glass windows  to view  in this church.  It's  a must to visit if you are in the neighborhood.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful churches in Canada
text: It is the largest Anglican church in the country. Spectacular inside and a great place to take a solitude break in the middle of a very busy city. Also great acoustics that allows for good music.

reviews.title: Great for tulip photos
text: Went by around the tulip season. Lots of great flowers, along with the beautiful structure. Good for a summer pictures.

reviews.title: Beautiful church with a great organ
text: Enjoyed stepping back in time and exploring this wonderful cathedral with a very good organ. It was recital day so we could hear the organ being played

reviews.title: Breathtaking!
text: We have traveled the world and seen many cathedrals and I have to say, St James Anglican Cathedral is at the top of my list.  It is a beautiful looking structure and the folks are amazing.  If you visit you must take a walk and stop in.

reviews.title: Wonderful old church and warm community
text: This is the seat of the Anglican Church in Canada and has played a huge part in the history of Toronto. Currently it is the home of a wonderful clergy and congregation that reaches out to the community to provide service and culture and social support.

The first time I was here was for a memorial service for a friend who received the full honours of its clergy for whom she had performed hours of volunteer support. The atmosphere was peaceful and created by light streaming through the beautiful stained glass windows. An adjacent church hall serves as a comfortable location for receptions following services.

reviews.title: Beautiful
text: I love to visit old churches, and since St James was within walking distance,...    A beautiful Cathedral, awe inspiring in architecture and detail.  I was also most inspired by their mission to serve others in their community.  God bless.

reviews.title: Quick Visit
text: Beautiful exterior and went in for a quick peak. Interesting the pews in the church had closed little doors. I've never seen that. Would be gorgeous for a wedding.

reviews.title: Very welcoming
text: We visited on the Thursday then attended the 11 am Sunday choral Eucharist.  Very welcoming people in a beautiful and light cathedral

reviews.title: A quick pop in is worth it
text: If you're checking out St.Lawrence Market or the first post office, you're already in the neighborhood, so pop in here.  Not as stunning as some other churches, but definitely had some unique architectural and design elements worth taking a look at.

reviews.title: St James Anglican Cathedral
text: If you have an hour or so to spare then spend your time wisely by visiting St James Cathedral. An excellent example of architecture with some interesting historical information inside. Well worth the visit.

reviews.title: Nice cathedral
text: Visited the cathedral whilst on a walking tour and very nice it is too . It is open during the day without charge and it has quite a long history going back a couple of hundred years . The stained glass is unique in many ways in that it shows First Nation people who are generally not of Christian religion . All in all a nice way to get some peace and quiet in Toronto .

reviews.title: Stunning Church
text: As an Episcopalian I truly loved this place. Stunning church physically but more so you can feel the Holy Spirit here. Happened to stop in when someone was rehearsing on the organ. Oh my!!

reviews.title: Welcoming to ...
text: This is a big cathedral located in old toronto and as others there are many beches colored windows and sculptures.
Near the front door a sign is that say welcome to hemosexuals!

reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful
text: The gothic architectural detail is amazing. The stained glass windows, spires, the park and gardens are all worth a visit...or at least a beautiful photo.

reviews.title: Worth a Visit if You’re Noodling Around
text: If you’re walking through old Toronto, it’s worth zigzagging up from Front Street to check out this lovely Cathedral. It’s very impressive and has a nice green space with some lovely shade for a hot summer day.  Great from all angles if photographing architecture is your thing.

reviews.title: Beautiful church
text: This was a beautiful church to visit!  The windows and woodwork were spectacular!  Beautiful park next to it as well!

reviews.title: Christmas service in Covid time
text: This neo-Gothic church is as attractive as ever, but attending a service here in Covid time is a bit disappointing. There is no choir, and the masks on people muffle the singing. On the other hand, contemplating the stained glass is always rewarding.

reviews.title: Beautiful architecture
text: Whether attending a service here or not, it is a very well worth while visit to admire the intricate detail both inside and out

reviews.title: On our visit, the Cathedral was open, and such a gorgeous place to visit!
text: It's wonderful, spiritual place, even for visitors. The fact that it was open was a marvel, but we don't know if it will continue to be with the COVID-19 restrictions. The light inside and architecture are beautiful. If you are in downtown Toronto and if this gorgeous place remains open, it should be a must-see!

reviews.title: Lovely and calm.  Truly welcoming people!
text: This cathedral is small and rather cosy.   Even I was quite surprised at the sweet welcome from the congregation, and the beautiful setting.   It is surrounded with art and spirituality, and set in a wonderful garden and exciting neighborhood.   My hotel was just across the square, so I stopped in often, and came to services as well.

reviews.title: Pretty good
text: Not in the top ranks of cathedrals but still worthy of note. We enjoyed the great stained glass windows especially behind the altar: see the pic.

reviews.title: A REAL DELIGHT
text: Apparently the oldest Anglican church in the city. My wife and I had the pleasure of visiting when having an extended stop over in Toronto. Both the outside and inside are spectacular. The wonderful stained glass windows being a real delight. Our visit to this atmospheric church was extremely interesting and well received.

reviews.title: Sunday Night Evensong
text: So what goes on in Toronto on a Sunday night?  Evensong from 4:30 to 5:30 full choir and organ.  They even through in a homily.
